content.title: The superfood trend continues. More recently, we told you about how to use avocado in skin and hair care, and today we will reveal the beauty secrets of pumpkin.

content.text: Pumpkin is a useful product that should not only be added to your autumn diet , but also used in skin and hair care. It contains: vitamins, beta-carotene, potassium, calcium, iron and other valuable components.

Pumpkin pulp is widely used in cooking and is prepared in different ways: boiled, stewed or consumed raw. We will not analyze how it affects the body, but will focus on the beauty of the skin and hair!

content.perechen: Rejuvenating effect (due to vitamins in the composition). It prevents the appearance of early wrinkles and fills cells with moisture.
Fights against free radicals (antioxidants in the composition) that can destroy cells.
Cleanses toxins and helps relieve inflammation.
Adds firmness and tone to the skin.
Makes hair softer , shinier and more silky.

content.text: Boil the pumpkin and take 2-3 tablespoons of pulp. Mix it with yogurt or sour cream and add a spoonful of honey. Apply for 10 minutes and then rinse off with warm water. All components are very active, so don't experiment if you have sensitive skin.

A pumpkin mask will help eliminate oily sheen , fight inflammation and make the skin look more matte. Take the egg white and beat until stiff. Mix with pulp (boiled) and apply for 10-15 minutes. Rinse off with warm water.
Another mask that's easy to make . Prepare the same consistency as for oily skin (pulp and protein) and add the applesauce. Apply for 7-10 minutes and rinse off.
The mask will add softness  and richness to the hair . To prepare such a product, use pumpkin juice or pulp. One of the simple homemade recipes.

Take pumpkin juice (4-5 spoons) and mix with olive and almond oil (you need a teaspoon). Apply from the middle of the main length. Wash off after 15-20 minutes. Please note, this product does not need to be used on scalp and roots. This will help avoid unwanted allergic reactions.
Before making homemade masks for skin or hair, test all components for sensitivity.
